author: Dan Treacy
title: Steve Sarkisian's battle with alcoholism: How becoming sober helped Texas coach reach College Football Playoff - Sporting News
text:
"Texas is back" has been uttered more than a few times over the last decade, but only now do the Longhorns truly appear to be back.
With a College Football Playoff berth in hand after a one-loss season to finish off its Big 12 tenure, Texas sits two wins away from a national championship and boasts one of the nation's top quarterbacks in Quinn Ewers.
Before Texas completed the ultimate turnaround, however, coach Steve Sarkisian had to turn his own life around. Alcoholism once left Sarkisian's coaching future uncertain, but he's found a home as leader of a Longhorns program that has a chance to re-emerge as a perennial title contender.
MORE:
First look at Texas' 2024 schedule as SEC tenure begins
Here's what you need to know about how Sarkisian overcame alcoholism, as well as how he credits his success at Texas to his long journey to sobriety.
Steve Sarkisian's battle with alcoholism
Like many public figures, not all of Sarkisian's battle played out privately. He took an indefinite leave of absence while serving as USC's head coach in 2015 after showing up to a pre-practice meeting intoxicated, and the school fired him the following day.
Other incidents were subsequently reported, with
ESPN reporting Sarkisian's assistants believed he was intoxicated during a game against Arizona State two weeks before his firing. The Los Angeles Times also detailed a handful of alcohol-fueled incidents involving Sarkisian during his time at Washington.
Sarkisian's alcoholism battle was a years-long struggle, but hitting rock bottom at USC helped finally push him to get to the help he needed and stay sober.
Sarkisian told CBS Sports in 2017 that then-Yankees pitcher CC Sabathia's decision to take himself off the postseason roster and enter a rehab facility for alcoholism in 2015 inspired him to seek help. Even after rehab, Sarkisian continued to attend Alcoholics Anonymous meetings.
A little help from Nick Saban also helped keep Sarkisian on the right path. Saban gave Sarkisian a chance early in the 2016 season when he hired the former USC coach as an offensive analyst. Sarkisian replaced Lane Kiffin as the program's offensive coordinator at the end of the season, but that stint was brief. By February 2017, Sarkisian was hired by the Atlanta Falcons as their offensive coordinator.
Saban still kept Sarkisian in mind and re-hired him as Alabama's offensive coordinator in 2019, giving Sarkisian a chance to coach Tua Tagovailoa, DeVonta Smith, Mac Jones and a slew of other NFL talents over the next two seasons. Sarkisian's success in Tuscaloosa, along with his continued commitment to sobriety, ultimately led to his opportunity to become the head coach at Texas ahead of the 2021 season.
Sarkisian also credits Saban with saving his life. Alabama administers a comprehensive physical exam for its coaching staff before every season, and that exam turned up a heart condition for Sarkisian that required emergency surgery in 2020.
Sarkisian has completely recovered, but had the issue not been detected, he was "potentially days and certainly weeks away from suffering a life-ending heart aneurysm,"
according to Yahoo Sports.
MORE:
SN's College Football Playoff predictions
Sarkisian enjoyed a full-circle moment when Texas went into Tuscaloosa and upset Alabama in September. Without that win, the Longhorns wouldn't be in the playoff and potentially staring down a rematch with the Tide in the championship game.
To get there, though, Sarkisian must defeat one of the teams he coached while he was still fighting to overcome alcoholism. Texas will face Washington in the Sugar Bowl for a chance to play for a championship, and a victory would take a resilient Sarkisian one step closer to the pinnacle of college football.
When did Steve Sarkisian become sober?
Sarkisian has been sober since he entered rehab after his firing at USC in 2015. He thinks about how his stint with the Trojans unceremoniously ended "every morning when he wakes up," according to Yahoo Sports, and Sarkisian has used that moment to keep himself on the right path ever since.
"I think it really shaped me, quite frankly,"
Sarkisian said in a 2021 radio interview describing the adversity he went through." Sarkisian added that his "perseverance to fight through" his battle with alcoholism has helped him better connect with the everyday struggles his players experience.
Now eight years sober, the mere fact Sarkisian is standing on the sideline as a College Football Playoff head coach could serve as inspiration to anyone going through what the the 49-year-old coach experienced.

author: Redacción GH
title: Detienen a dos que conducían un vehículo robado
text:
Detienen a dos que conducían un vehículo robado
Dos sujetos fueron detenidos cuando circulaban a bordo de un vehículo que contaba con una pre denuncia de robo.
Mexicali, Baja California.- Dos sujetos fueron detenidos por elementos de la Policía Municipal cuando circulaban a bordo de un vehículo que contaba con una pre
denuncia de robo.
La tarde de este miércoles se reportó al número de emergencias que una camioneta Dodge Ram 1500 de color azul había sido robada de un domicilio y que en ella circulaban dos sujetos.
Tras un operativo de búsqueda implementado por los agentes policiales, se localizó el vehículo, el cual circulaba por el bulevar Lázaro Cárdenas. Los agentes solicitaron a los ocupantes que detuvieran su marcha.
Al lugar llegó la víctima, quien informó que el vehículo había sido robado de su domicilio durante la mañana y que ya había presentado una
predenuncia de robo. Los tripulantes del vehículo no pudieron demostrar que el automóvil les pertenecía.
Los sujetos fueron identificados como Alejandro “N”, de 29 años, e Iván Martín “N”, de 33 años. Ambos fueron trasladados a la Subcomandancia Zona Este de la Policía Municipal para ser puestos a disposición de la Fiscalía General del Estado (FGE).

author: Savannah Leigh Richardson
title: The PLAYERS: Rory McIlroy makes history with legendary performance - SBNation.com
text: [Rory McIlroy](https://www.sbnation.com/golf/2024/3/13/24100119/players-championship-rory-mcilroy-defend-pga-tour-jay-monahan) joined a bit of history at [The PLAYERS Championship](https://www.sbnation.com/golf/2024/3/12/24099020/players-championship-2024-sb-nation-staff-predictions) Thursday, carding a record-tying 10 birdies during a 7-under 65 round. That places McIlroy into a tie atop the leaderboard with Xander Schauffele. After a disastrous final round at the [Arnold Palmer Invitational,](https://www.sbnation.com/golf/2024/3/10/24096516/pga-news-rory-mcilroy-arnold-palmer-invitational-plummet) the Northern Irishman spent the last few days working on his game. “It’s probably been one of my best days in a while, which is nice,” McIlroy said. Those 10 birdies [tie the record](https://x.com/JustinRayGolf/status/1768333529807782305?s=20) for a single round at The PLAYERS. It’s also the most McIlroy has made in 641 days, dating back to the final round of the 2022 Canadian Open, per the Athletic’s Justin Ray. Only four other players have made 10 birdies in a round, with the most recent being held by Justin Thomas when he won here in 2021. Rory McIlroy: 10 birdies, tying— Justin Ray (@JustinRayGolf) [@THEPLAYERS]record for a single round and his most in a PGA Tour round in 641 days (final round of 2022 Canadian Open). McIlroy gained well over 3 strokes with his approach play today - a stark contrast from his early season struggles. [March 14, 2024] Putting has been one of his weak spots recently, but he leads the field thus far after picking up 3.593 strokes on the greens. His approach game was also much improved, which is another thing he has prioritized. The 2019 PLAYERS champion picked up 3.778 strokes in his approach game— the second-best in the field. He began his day on the back nine with three straight birdies. The four-time major winner added three more birdies to his scorecard in the next five holes before he dropped a shot at the 18th. McIlroy got back to 6-under on the par-5 2nd after making a tap-in birdie. His eighth circle on the scorecard came at the 4th, with another to follow at six. He dropped a shot on seven, where he recorded a double-bogey. That hole included a lengthy discussion between him, Jordan Spieth and [Viktor Hovland](https://www.sbnation.com/golf/2024/3/14/24100734/viktor-hovland-pga-tour-jay-monahan-liv-golf-sweep-under-rug), on where he should drop after hitting the ball into the water off the tee. McIlroy returned to 7-under on the 9th when he made that historic 10th birdie from 17 feet. “It was disappointing not to get that up-and-down on 7, but that’s probably why I give it a little mini-fist pump on 9 to feel like I got one of those shots back,” McIlroy said. Rory McIlroy birdies his final hole of the day to tie the lead and cap off an excellent opening 65 at TPC Sawgrass.— Golf Channel (@GolfChannel) : Golf Channel & [@peacock]| [#THEPLAYERS] [pic.twitter.com/Yr9fzfsi0D] [March 14, 2024] McIlroy’s fist pump says it all. He was thrilled with his round despite hitting into the penalty twice. To make 10 birdies on [TPC Sawgrass](https://www.sbnation.com/golf/2024/3/12/24097805/pga-tour-players-championship-tpc-sawgrass-toughest-4-holes) is not an easy feat. “It would be nice to shoot 62 and not have two in the water, I guess,” McIlroy said. The last few years have seen him struggle on Day 1 of this event and put him in a hole. McIlroy won’t have to do that this week. “It goes back to I didn’t have many expectations out there today because I was like, ‘Okay, feels good on the range and feels good in practice, but let’s see how it is when you’ve got a card in your hand,’” he said. “There’s something to be said for that, sort of lessening the expectations and going out there and seeing what happens.” McIlroy will look to build off that 65 Friday as he tees off alongside Hovland and Spieth at 1:40 p.m. ET. Savannah Leigh Richardson is a golf staff writer for SB Nation’s Playing Through. For more golf coverage, be sure to follow us [@_PlayingThrough](https://twitter.com/_PlayingThrough) on all major social platforms. You can also follow her on Twitter [@SportsGirlSL](https://twitter.com/SportsGirlSL) and Instagram @savannah_leigh_sports.

author: Staff Reporter
title: Grounds curators praise workshop
text:
BRIDGETOWN, Barbados (CMC) – Participants who have completed a series of workshops on groundsmanship over the past month have hailed the initiative.
Over 100 men and women went through theoretical and practical sessions geared towards education and re-education on the rudiment of their crucial role of pitch preparation and outfield maintenance in preparation for the ICC Men’s Twenty20 World Cup 2024 West Indies & United States.
Former Barbados left-arm spinner Winston Reid, the lead curator for the Barbados Cricket Association (BCA), said the workshops were a good idea.
“This is something that should be encouraged, and I know the staff here benefitted tremendously,” he said.
“It was a wonderful eye-opener, an education in many ways; it was enlightening and interactive … and the responses I got from the others who participated, said to me it was clear they too benefitted in a meaningful way.”
Reid, who is based at Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, the venue for the final of the T20 World Cup to be played on Saturday, June 29, had a hugely successful cricket career, playing over 100 matches at the senior level for Barbados.
He joined the staff at the historic venue 19 years ago ahead of the ICC Men’s (50 overs) Cricket World Cup 2007 and has supervised the work at the iconic ground over that time.
“The reason behind the workshop was to improve in every way we can and to do better at our jobs,” Reid said.
“We are gearing up towards the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, which will be the biggest event we have ever hosted. We will be staging the final at this magnificent venue, so we want to make sure everyone is fully equipped.”
He said: “Not only for Kensington, but for curatorship at all the other venues around the island and the region. We want to see better pitches and fields and playing conditions for our players to show their skills and to entertain the fans in the stands.
“So, this was a very timely workshop series, which augurs well for the game in the West Indies going forward.”
Six territories in the Caribbean will host matches in the ninth edition of the T20 World Cup, which will be played from June 1 to 29.
The Caribbean, which hosted the event 14 years ago, will hold matches at Kensington Oval, Vivian Richards Cricket Ground in Antigua, National Cricket Stadium in Guyana, Daren Sammy Cricket Ground in St Lucia, Arnos Vale Sports Complex in St Vincent, and Brian Lara Cricket Academy in Trinidad.
The event will be the largest in the tournament’s history with 20 international teams playing 55 matches across nine locations.
It is the first time that the United States will host matches at a T20 World Cup, with 16 first round contests split between the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium a little outside the city of New York, Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in the city of Dallas in the state of Texas, and Broward County Stadium in the city of Lauderhill in the state of Florida.
CWI manager of cricket operations and head of cricket for the T20 World Cup, Roland Holder, said the series was crafted by the organisers and designed to up-skill existing curators across the Caribeban by exposing them to international best practices for pitch preparation and applicable maintenance.
The former Barbados captain and West Indies batsman said the workshops were also designed to simultaneously expand the cadre of curators in the Caribbean by identifying new talent with the appropriate combination of theoretical knowledge and practical exposure, to lend further expertise to match venues to deliver a world-class event in June.
A CWI Curators’ Manual was also produced in the lead up to the workshop and will be disseminated to the curators to help them in their work.

author: 潘婷
title: 潍坊安丘这所学校开展麦收活动，盼学子 "麦" 向未来_潍坊新闻_大众网
text:
大众网记者 武文惠 通讯员 夏敏 潍坊报道
在潍坊安丘青云双语学校劳动实践基地里，金色麦浪随风起伏，阵阵麦香沁人心脾。沉甸甸的麦穗象征着成长与收获，为培养学生良好的劳动意识，教育学生崇尚劳动，提升劳动实践能力，6月11日下午，安丘市青云双语学校开展麦收劳动实践活动。师生们拿起镰刀，小心翼翼割下成熟的麦穗，分享给即将踏上“战场”的初三学子们，希望他们金榜题名，“麦”向成功，“麦”向未来！
金黄的麦田里，同学们难掩兴奋的心情，认真聆听劳动指导师讲述小麦的生长过程，仔细观看收麦的讲解和示范。轮到同学们大显身手了——大家躬身弯腰，左手握小麦，右手挥舞镰刀，用力一拉，动作一气呵成。一会工夫，小麦就在镰刀的飞舞中倒下一片。沉甸甸的麦穗，沉甸甸的收获。额头上的滴滴汗水，正是丰收最好的写照。
收割完后，同学们捡拾麦穗并将其运送到打谷场地，劳动指导师们现场示范小麦脱粒的技巧与方法，同学们亲身实践碌碡[liù zhou]压麦和扬场脱壳等工序，感受农耕文化的魅力。看着一颗颗完整脱落的麦粒，同学们满心欢喜。“春种一粒粟，秋收万颗子”在此刻不再是课本上干巴巴的文字，而是活生生的切身体验。
活动最后，同学们精心挑选出颗粒饱满的麦穗，用红色丝带细心捆扎，用这一份带着泥土芬芳、凝聚辛勤汗水与真挚情谊的礼物，为学长学姐们加油鼓劲。希望初三毕业生们像麦穗的芒一样锋芒毕露，“左手握金穗，右手定乾坤”。
一粒种子到金黄的麦香，需要多少屈脚蹲伏，缩臂弯腰；一个懵懂的孩童到今天苦读的收藏，需要多少的心智与时间、挣扎与顽强。亲爱的孩子，愿你每份耕耘都有收获！

author: elperiodico.com
title: GLOBOS DE ORO 2024 | Margot Robbie Barbie
text:
Margot podría alzarse con su primer Globo de Oro gracias a ‘Barbie’, película que cuenta con 9 nominaciones, entre otras, la de Mejor Actriz. Sale a la luz cuánto ha ganado Margot Robbie con la película de ‘Barbie’ Silvia Vázquez - 28/12/2023, 21:34 El ‘efecto Barbie’ ha llegado a los Globos de Oro 2024 gracias a Margot Robbie. Con un total de 9 nominaciones , la aplaudida película en la que da vida a la muñeca más famosa de la historia parte como la gran favorita de estos galardones y ha convertido a la actriz en una de las invitadas más esperadas de la edición.
Su aparición sobre la alfombra roja de estos premios, considerados la antesala de los Oscar, no ha defraudado. En línea con la estrategia de lookazos rosas que siguió durante la gira promocional de la cinta por todo el mundo el pasado verano, Margot ha llegado este 7 de enero al Hotel Beverly Hilton de Beverly Hills en Los Ángeles (California) con (rosa)
La intérprete se mide esta noche en la categoría de Mejor Actriz de Comedia o Musical con otras grandes de Hollywood, como Jennifer Lawrence, Natalie Portman o Emma Stone. De salir victoriosa, este sería el primer Globo de Oro de Margot Robbie , que ya ha estado nominada en otras tres ocasiones anteriormente pero nunca se ha llevado la estatuilla a casa.
El estilo de Margot Robbie en los Globos de Oro 2023: la antesala de 'Barbie'
Como decíamos, esta no es la primera vez que la actriz asiste, deslumbrante, a los Globos de Oro. De hecho, en la pasada edición de 2023 fue una de las invitadas más aclamadas. Pese a que asistía como nominada a Mejor Actriz en una Película Musical o de Comedia por su papel en 'Babylon' , Margot ya nos dejó un aperitivo de lo que nos depararía el año al escoger un vestido rosa que parecía ser un guiño a ‘Barbie’ , cuyas primeras imágenes ya habían salido a la luz en aquel momento aunque todavía quedaban meses para el estreno. En concreto, optó por un vestido de tul de seda con transparencias y aplicaciones de cristales, plumas en la falda y broche joya en el escote , que lleva el sello de Chanel , ‘maison’ con la que mantuvo una prolífica relación durante años.
Margot Robbie en los Globos de Oro 2023 con vestido de Chanel
/ Getty Images 2021: postpandemia
No es casualidad por tanto que en 2021 la intérprete también confiara en esta casa francesa para pisar la ‘red carpet’ de los Globos de Oro, la última antes de la caída en desgracia de estos galardones que sufrieron el boicot de Hollywood . ¿Su apuesta? Un diseño estampado de la colección primavera-verano 2021 que dejaba los hombros al descubierto y que lució en esta atípica gala , celebrada entre Los Ángeles y Nueva York por razones de seguridad frente al Covid . Como productora principal de la película, Margot presentó el tráiler de la película ‘Promising Young Woman’, nominada en la categoría de Mejor Película de Drama.
Todos los looks de la alfombra roja de los Globos de Oro 2021 24 fotos
2020: alianza con Chanel
De la misma forma, un año antes Margot Robbie estaba nominada a los Globos de Oro 2020 por su papel en la película ‘Bombshell’ a Mejor Actriz de Reparto y brilló gracias a un look de colección de Alta Costura de 2019 de Chanel creado por Virginie Viard, con cuerpo de lentejuelas y falda tubo blanca.
Margot Robbie en los Globos de Oro 2020 con look de Alta Costura de Chanel
/ Getty Images 2018: primera nominación
En la histórica edición de 2018 que tiñó de negro la alfombra roja en respuesta al caso Weinstein, Margot se decantó por un vestido de Gucci con hombros estructurados y escote de infarto en el que destacan los bordados metalizados a modo de lazo y flores. Aquella fue la primera vez que acudía como nominada, concretamente en la categoría de Mejor Actriz Protagonista en Película Cómica o Musical por la cinta ‘I, Tonya’ , con la que además debutó como productora.
Margot Robbie en los Globos de Oro 2018 con vestido de Gucci
/ Getty Images 2015: su debut en los Globos de Oro
Noticias relacionadas La escena de 'Barbie' que Greta Gerwig se negó a cortar a pesar de las presiones: "Es el corazón de la película" ¿Quién es Tom Ackerley, el discreto y atractivo marido de Margot Robbie? Para remontarnos a la primera vez que Margot estuvo en los Globos de Oro tenemos que retroceder hasta 2015. Su carrera había despegado poco antes gracias a su participación en ‘El lobo de Wall Street’ junto a Leonardo diCaprio, por lo que era de una de las primeras ‘red carpets’ importantes a las que asistía. Para la ocasión eligió un vestido columna de Gucci, en color marfil, con aplicaciones de pedrería y una abertura de infarto que le cedía protagonismo a sus zapatos ‘peep-toe’ en verde esmeralda.
Margot Robbie en los Globos de Oro 2015 con vestido de Gucci
/ Getty Images
